meanings.definition: The quality or state of being cytopathogenic.
meanings.sent1: The cytopathogenicities of the virus were evident under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Researchers studied the cytopathogenicities of different pathogens to understand their effects on cells.
meanings.sent3: The cytopathogenicities of the bacteria were so extreme that they seemed like tiny cell destroyers.
meanings.sent4: The cytopathogenicities of the chemical were like invisible wrecking balls inside the cells.
meanings.sent5: The vivid red color of the cytopathogenicities made them stand out in the cell sample.

meanings.definition: The ability to cause cellular damage or disease.
meanings.sent1: Doctors were concerned about the cytopathogenicities of the new virus spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The cytopathogenicities of the toxin were evident in the damaged cells.
meanings.sent3: The tiny but powerful cytopathogenicities of the bacteria wreaked havoc on the cell population.
meanings.sent4: The cytopathogenicities of the disease were like silent assassins attacking the cells.
meanings.sent5: The researcher's microscope revealed the destructive cytopathogenicities of the pathogen.
